discussion.content:
B: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-Access/19.03/com.vmware.wsp-resource/GUID-2FE82C63-4C01-47E6-A5A2-6C9EB908A2D1.html
Before you configure Citrix server farm details in the VMware Identity Manager console, you must complete certain prerequisite tasks. You must deploy and configure the Integration Broker, a VMware Identity Manager component, on a supported Windows Server and set up Citrix PowerShell remoting to enable communication between the Integration Broker and the Citrix server farm.

To configure Citrix XenApp and XenDesktop server farms in VMware Identity Manager, you create one or more virtual apps collections in the Virtual Apps Configuration page, which contain configuration information such as the Citrix servers from which to sync resources and entitlements, the Integration Broker to use for sync and SSO, the VMware Identity Manager connector to use for sync, and administrator settings such as the default launch clien

questions.question_text: In order for an administrator to utilize a Citrix deployment that includes Citrix NetScaler with VMware Identity Manager, what does the administrator need to deploy?

If IPv4 is selected, this setting is selected by default. If IPv6 is selected, this setting is not displayed because HTML Access is not supported in an IPv6 environment.

choices.D: IPv4 is selected as Internet Protocol (IP)
choices.C: IPv6 is selected as Internet Protocol (IP)
choices.B: Configure Windows Firewall automatically option is selected

questions.question_text:
During an installation of View Connection Server, the Install HTML Access option setting is not being displayed in the installer.
What is the probable cause?
What is the effect of changing any VMware Blast policy that cannot be changed in real time?

choices.A: VMware Tools services is restarted by Microsoft GPO Update service
choices.D: Horizon Client detects the change and prompts the user to reboot once every 480 seconds
choices.C: VMware Tools detects the change and immediately applies the new setting within 480 seconds
choices.B: Microsoft GPO update rules apply. GPOs are updated manually or by restarting the Horizon Agent

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
If the following VMware Blast policies change during a client session, Horizon Client detects the change and immediately applies the new setting.

H264
Audio Playback
Max Session Bandwidth
Min Session Bandwidth
Max Frame Rate
Image Quality
For all other VMware Blast policies, Microsoft GPO update rules apply. GPOs can be updated manually or by restarting the Horizon Agent machine. For more information, see the Microsoft documentation.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.13/horizon-remote-desktop-features/GUID-220442CF-EA01-470E-A381-1BED9BC0B81C.html

Selected Answer: C
it is referring to "VMware Blast policy that cannot be changed in real time" so it requires MS GPO update rule. so the correct answer is C

comments.content: But of a rubbish question again as it states if any policies change so could be B or C
But the Answer is B as per same link as Valia above

discussion.content:
If the following VMware Blast policies change during a client session, Horizon Client detects the change and immediately applies the new setting.

H264

Audio Playback

Max Session Bandwidth

Min Session Bandwidth

Max Frame Rate

Image Quality

For all other VMware Blast policies, Microsoft GPO update rules apply. GPOs can be updated manually or by restarting the Horizon Agent machine.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.6/horizon-remote-desktop-features/GUID-220442CF-EA01-470E-A381-1BED9BC0B81C.html

choices.D: The View administrator password contains a special character that was not escaped
choices.C: There is not enough free space in the /var partition
choices.A: The Linux virtual machine was not joined to the Active Directory
choices.B: The View Connection Server FQDN, user name, or password was incorrect

questions.question_text:
An administrator installs the Horizon Agent on a Linux virtual machine, and the error

Agent Registration Failed -
is displayed.
What might be two causes for this error? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The correct answer is C. Item 6 under procedures. 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.7/horizon-virtual-desktops/GUID-1F2D0C6E-6379-4B52-A7EA-C1EF09CE2F9B.html

comments.content: Sorry: the correct answer is C: If "... an administrator is UNABLE to use..." then the incorrect agent was selected. In other words, instead of selecting Instant Clone agent, the View Composer Agent (for linked clones) was selected.

discussion.content:
I would go for B.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.7/horizon-virtual-desktops/GUID-1F2D0C6E-6379-4B52-A7EA-C1EF09CE2F9B.html
step 6

choices.D: When installing the Horizon View Agent, the vRealize Operations Desktop Agent option was selected
choices.B: When installing the Horizon View Agent, the VMware Horizon Instant Clone Agent option was selected
choices.C: When installing the Horizon View Agent, the VMware Horizon View Composer Agent option was selected
choices.A: When installing the Horizon View Agent, the Client Drive Redirection option was selected
